short_summary: The Canadian Ministry of Defense has replaced five wildland firefighters with modernized and well-equipped vehicles that incorporate both fire fighting chemicals and an advanced drive system.
description: Under the scope of this project, the following equipment has to be included - one light weight fire truck, 12,000 fire fighting foams, advanced drive system, and cell phone installation.
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Wildland Firefighting Vehicles with Compressed Air Foam Systems

**Solicitation Number:** WS4698001586

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GS)

Under this RFP, the Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking a contract for the provision of:

* Five (5) Wildland Firefighting Vehicles with Compressed Air Foam Systems (CAFS) to the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) at various locations across Canada.
* An optional unfunded procurement of five (5) additional vehicles, to be exercised within 12 months, subject to project requirements.

**Key Requirements:**

* Each vehicle must be:
	+ Equipped with a CAFS system, meeting the specified technical requirements
	+ Compatible with the CAF's existing vehicle fleet and infrastructure
	+ Delivered to designated locations, as specified in the contract

**Tendering Documents:**

The tendering documents, including the Request for Proposal (RFP), are available on the Government of Canada's procurement platform: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20447042](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20447042)

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical Proposal: 40%
* Pricing: 30%
* Past Performance: 10%
* Business Prospects: 20%

**Timeline:**

* Deadline for Submission: October 28, 2024, at 14:00 EST
* Notice of Completion: December 2024

**Contact Information:**

For any inquiries or clarification regarding this RFP, please contact:

Way, Stephanie (SPAC/PSPC)
stephanie.way@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Language of Tendering:**

The tendering documents and language of the project are both English and French.

Note that this is a combined tender announcement and will follow the procedures specified in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
